title: Update: Not recommended!
body:
I have had it for ~4.5 months, making two cappuccinos a day:

The Pro's are still valid. However:
Last week is stopped heating the milk, and the froth was not stable, i.e. it "melted" away within 10 minutes. I used whole milk only, and I tried two brands, both which always works well. My previous three frothers of same design lasted 2-3 years.

Not recommended!

Previous review, late October:
Pro-s:
- Makes very good, dense and homogeneous froth. The best I have had. I have had two stem frothers and three "can" frothers.
- Very easy to clean. The surface in it is really great. I basically just swirl some water around twice immediately after use, and then once before next use. I only wash it every 2-3 days by running it for 15-20 seconds with soap water, and then using a soft brush for 20 seconds.

Con-s: (Not big, but buyer should know)
- A bit slow. I.e. I do two runs with my espresso machine (4 shots), and you need to start the frother when you start the first two espresso shots, otherwise you'll be waiting ... My sense is that the spinner goes a little slow and the heating is slower to avoid milk burning inside the bowl.
- Capacity is a tad small. When I fill it to the "max" line I end up with a "dry" 4-shot cappuccino, which is what I want. If you want a "milkier" drink you may have a challenge.

Not any more: If you are o.k. with the above, I highly recommend this thing. The froth is really good and it is very easy to keep clean!
